Claim Maintenance

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the major parts of a claim

Use the full search capability of ClaimCenter
Describe the information available on the
Claim Summary

Navigate to Claim details from the Claim
Summary

Describe what a supervisor does

In our insurance business, there are a
lot of parts to a claim. In the old days
we used to keep a physical file for
each claim. Now, we keep the same
information, but electronically. | need
to know where and how to maintain all
the parts of a claim.

Jun
Claims
Supervisor

| Policy and coverages G

¢ Apolicy is a contract between the

carrier and the insured in which the
carrier promises to cover (indemnify)
the insured for specific types of losses policy coverage

« Acoverage is a type of loss that is or
can be listed on a policy which the
carrier will cover

* In the case of Workers’ Compensation, the
coverage(s) is (are) determined by
applicable laws/acts/regulations

| The claim G

A claim is an event in which one or more (potentially) covered losses occurs

* The policy's line of business determines the claim's line of business

workers’ comp auto policy property policy

=) |*

workers’ comp claim auto claim property claim

| Contacts

Roles involved
with providing
services

Roles involved
e& with the loss
( ] event
C) a)

policy and
coverages

Gi

¢ Contact information is captured when
the claim is first created

¢ Acontact is a person or organization
who has a relationship to a claim,
such as:

+ Aclaimant requesting compensation for a
loss

* The reporter of the claim
+ Adoctor treating an injury

+ An auto repair shop providing an estimate

| incidents G

eo vetages ¢ An incident is the ‘what’ that was
lost or damaged
: mn ¢ An incident is a collection of
claim * .
information about damage

* It typically represents an item that
was lost or damaged, such as:

+ Apperson suffering one or more injuries
+ Lost wages

| Service Requests

policy and
coverages

claim | ANI

Gi

¢ Aservice request is a request for
work to be performed by a vendor,
usually related to an incident.

+ Examples include hospitalization, emergency
evacuation, physical therapy, and so on

* Service Request types can include
Quote only, Service only, or both Quote
and Service

¢ Service Requests can track quotes
and vendor communications

exposure

¢« An exposure is a set of data used to
track a potential indemnity from one
coverage to one claimant

« An indemnity is a payment in
compensation for a covered loss
¢ In Workers’ Compensation insurance,

the goal is to compensate the worker
for medical expenses and lost wages

| Activities G

policy and
coverages

An activity is a task that may
be required to process a claim

The set of activities associated
with a given claim is referred
to as the claim's "workplan"

Activity due dates and
statuses are used for business
processes and reporting

Activities may be created

Les ON workplan manually or through business
c—4 Ap .9@ rules
|| °F oe

contact incident service exposure

| Documents

policy and ° A document is an electronic file or ;

coverages physical piece of paper which contains
information relevant to the claim

* May consist of photographs, diagrams,
assessments, estimates, and so on

2 BOO & &

ow NE oo. eer a activity document
S=2

contact incident service exposure

| Notes

policy and
coverages

Gi

A note is a text entry which details the
events, courses of actions, and thought
process of a user during the processing
of aclaim

@ & [fa b

ON activity document note

exposure

| Matters G&G

policy and A matter is a set of data pertaining to a
coverages . . 7
single (potential) lawsuit

| « Matters may include case numbers, court dates,
claim primary attorneys, and other details

20@08 OD
ow UN EE + P) activity document note matter
I ;

contact incident service exposure

| Reserve lines

or (@-
e;

policy and
coverages

Gi

A reserve line is an amount of money set
aside for payments against an exposure

exposure

+ Areserve line is implemented through
transactions that add to and subtract from the

reserve line

&, = @
BSS
activity document _ note matter

reserve

| Checks Gi

eo vetages Acheck is any type of payment (check,
electronic funds transfer)
| + Acheck may contain multiple payment
claim transactions from different reserve lines

ow AN...“ a activity document _ note matter
S=3

contact incident service exposure

reserve

Tanya

Customer

Service
Representative

a

There are a lot of times when a customer
calls in for help, but they don’t know their
claim number. They may know anything
from their license number to the amount
of a check they received. | need to be
able to find their claim with very little
information.

| Demonstration G

CSR — Claim search and activities

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

As an adjuster, | have a lot of
independent tasks that must be
addressed every day. These tasks can be
on multiple claims and can have varying
levels of importance. | need the ability to
check and organize my workload.

_Tanvi :
Adjuster \ee/

| Demonstration G

_. Adjuster — Check workplan and
— documents
click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

As a supervisor, | am responsible for
ensuring that claims are processed
correctly and in a timely manner. | need
to know if there are issues that require
special attention. | also need to manage
my team’s workload.

Jun
Claims ¢
Supervisor

| Demonstration G

Supervisor — Check escalated activities

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

the Desktop. ClaimCenter application server is ready.

Eee nittp://localhost:8080/cc/ClaimCenter.do [igus

Connect to the application URL. After finishing
exercises, Stop
ClaimCenter
